titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Education, Sexuality, and Religion unit, Office Files of Cyrus Driver
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Education, Sexuality, and Religion unit, Office Files of Cyrus Driver FA1844

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:27:53 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Education, Sexuality, and Religion unit, Office Files of Cyrus Driver

physdesc.extent: 19 document boxes: 17 letter size boxes, 1 oversize box, and 1 AV half-letter box

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011.
This material was transferred to the RAC in 2021 in two different sets of records and was ingested by the RAC as Accession 2021:079 and Accession 2021:116.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the files Cyrus Driver created during his support and leadership of the Ford Foundation's programming for education from the late 1990s to the 2000s. The majority of the collection's content originates from between 1998 and 2005. During that time, Driver served as a Program Officer in the Foundation's Education, Media, Arts, and Culture Program (EMAC), Education, Knowledge, and Religion unit (EKR), then as a Program Officer in the Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Education, Sexuality, and Religion unit (ESR), and then as Deputy Director of the KCF ESR unit. Little documentation on Driver's later career at the Foundation as Director of Program Learning and Innovation is included within the collection.

The collection is comprised of one series of subject files. These files primarily document Driver's grant portfolio responsibilities for the Foundation's areas of focus in education as well as his engagement with the larger philanthropic field's interest in education. Driver managed grants that specifically focused on public school reform, particularly for schools in urban districts, improving access for teacher professional development, assessment of school systems, community involvement in school systems, and making education more equitable. Support for undergraduate preparation, community colleges, and preventing anti-LGBTQ discrimination and harassment in schools is also documented. A large number of files pertain to the Ford Foundation's Collaborating for Educational Reform Initiative (CERI).

Common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, notes, reports, drafts, grant recommendations, publications, news articles, and meeting materials. There is also a VHS tape and a few digital media items.

did.unittitle: Subject files

physdesc.extent: 19 document boxes: 17 letter size boxes, 1 oversize box, and 1 AV half-letter box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains the subject files Cyrus Driver created and maintained when he worked in the Ford Foundation's Education, Media, Arts, and Culture Program (EMAC), Education, Knowledge, and Religion unit (EKR) and Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Education, Sexuality, and Religion unit (ESR). Driver worked as a Program Officer in EMAC EKR and then KCF ESR and then was Deputy Director for KCF ESR.

Files in the series pertaining to Driver's grant portfolio responsibilities largely concern the Foundation's support of organizations seeking to improve public schools. Many records show Driver's work on the Foundation's Collaborating for Educational Reform Initiative (CERI) which sought to increase public support for education reform in communities. CERI funded eight different sites to promote increased professional development for teachers and increased parental and community involvement in schools. Driver's CERI files document site proposal responses, site visits, and site assessments from the RAND Corporation.

Other grantee related files concern support for making education more equitable, for preparing undergraduate students for college, community colleges through the Rural Community College Initiative (RCCI) and Community Colleges Bridges to Opportunity (CCBOI), and for preventing anti-LGBTQ discrimination and harassment in schools. Correspondence, notes, grant recommendations, reports, promotional materials, and meeting materials make up these files. The Ford Foundation's engagement with other foundations and philanthropic organizations' involvement with education is also documented within the series.

Other common material formats found in the collection that have not been previously mentioned include news articles, publications, a VHS tape, and a few digital media items. A few of the publications are located at the end of the series.
